column2: 8:48 AM&Hands-on-Machine-Learning&Chapter 10. Introduction to Artificial Neural Networks with Keras - From Biological to Artificial Neurons - The Perceptron&&The Perceptron is one of the simplest ANN architectures
column3: invented in 1957 by Frank Rosenblatt. It is based on a slightly different artificial neuron (see Figure 10-4) called From Biological to Artificial Neurons | 281&281&0

column2: 8:54 AM&Hands-on-Machine-Learning&Chapter 10. Introduction to Artificial Neural Networks with Keras - From Biological to Artificial Neurons - The Perceptron&&(or Hebbian learning); that is
column3: the connection weight between two neurons is increased whenever they have the same output.&281&1

column2: 8:54 AM&Hands-on-Machine-Learning&Chapter 10. Introduction to Artificial Neural Networks with Keras - From Biological to Artificial Neurons - The Perceptron&&Note that contrary to Logistic Regression classifiers
column3: Perceptrons do not output a class probability; rather
column4: they just make predictions based on a hard threshold.&282&1
